Class Row

  • java.lang.Object
    • Row
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoupleRow, EmptyRow, NormalRow

    public abstract class Row
extends java.lang.Object
    Hold for row object. It supports display with status and reserve or assign a seat in the row.
    Author:
    SS3-grp6

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Row(int numOfSeats)
      Construct row with number of seats

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void assignSeat(int seatID)
      Set status of seat according to seatID to assigned
      abstract boolean checkNoSingleEmptySeat()
      Check whether a row is valid or not based on whether there exists a single empty seat.
      abstract void displayrow()
      Display row with status of each seat in that row, which will be overrided by child classes of rows.
      int getWidth()
      Get width of the row
      int reserveSeat(int seatID)
      Set the status of seat to reserved.
      void reset()
      Empty all seats in the row.
      void unreserveSeat(int seatID)
      Clear status reserved of seat according to seatID

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • displayrow

        public abstract void displayrow()
        Display row with status of each seat in that row, which will be overrided by child classes of rows.

      • checkNoSingleEmptySeat

        public abstract boolean checkNoSingleEmptySeat()
        Check whether a row is valid or not based on whether there exists a single empty seat.
        Returns:
        true if valid, otherwise false

        Get width of the row
